intro: Selenipedium × cardinale var. vannerae, commonly known as the yellow siphonostele, is a rare and striking member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, showy yellow flowers that resemble those of the ginger family. The plant is native to the cloud forests of Central America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a distinctive, hollow stem and fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
